required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Mindfulness Practices for Healthcare Professional Trainees
clinical_study.official_title: Mindfulness Practices for Healthcare Professional Trainees

brief_summary.textblock: A newly developed intervention, Mindfulness Based Practices for Health Care Professionals in Training: Clinical Applications, will be piloted to determine the feasibility and accessibility within this population. The purpose of the proposed study is to assess the change in perceived stress at work/school and psychological symptomology; i.e., depression, stress, emotion regulation, and dispositional mindfulness, from pre to post intervention in health care professional students and when compared to a matched control group.

detailed_description.textblock: The proposed study aims to investigate an 8-week intervention: Mindfulness Based Practices for Health Care Professionals in Training: Clinical Applications. During the intervention, participants will engage in didactic education, experiential mindfulness practices, including gentle yoga, and group dialogue. The aim of the study is to investigate the feasibility of this intervention in producing measurable differences between the participants and matched controls on their perception of their well-being and clinical work.

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Maslach Burnout Inventory a 22 item screening tool with higher values indicating more burnout

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Patient Health Questionnaire 9. 9-items with lower values indicating less depression

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using State Trait Anxiety Inventory -- a 20 item measure with some items reverse scored and higher scored indicating higher state anxiety

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Rumination Response Scale -- a 10 item measure with higher scores indicating higher rumination

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Perceived Stress Scale -- a 14-item scale with higher scores indicating higher levels of stress

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire -- a 39-item measure of 5 domains of mindfulness in daily life, with higher scores indicating higher levels of mindfulness

primary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline and post-intervention (8 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: Assessed using Trail Making Test A & B -- a brief task requiring respondents to connect numbered dots and then switch between number and letters, speed and accuracy are both recorded

secondary_outcome.time_frame: administered at baseline, post-intervention (8 weeks), and 3 month post-intervention follow-up
secondary_outcome.description: Assessed using Interprofessional Team Training Assessment -- a 22-item measure and Student Perceptions of Physician-Pharmacist Interprofessional Clinical Education -- a 10-item measure; both with higher scores indicating more positive attitudes toward interprofessional training

secondary_outcome.measure: Follow-up Interview of Perceptions of Mindfulness and Interprofessional Education
secondary_outcome.description: qualitative interview and exploration -- participants will spend approximately 30 minute by phone being interviewed on their experiences with the intervention especially in the context of healthcare and interprofessional education

arm_group.arm_group_label: Mindfulness Based Practices for Health Care Professionals

intervention.intervention_name: Mindfulness Based Practices for Health Care Professionals in Training
intervention.description: Eight weekly sessions including didactic lecture, discussion, homework, gentle yoga, and meditation and mindfulness exercises
intervention.arm_group_label: Mindfulness Based Practices for Health Care Professionals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Students/faculty from any health care department at VCU
Exclusion Criteria:
- Anyone who is not a student/faculty from a health care department at VCU
